result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daquan Tyanthony Blue

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daquan Tyanthony Blue appeared by video.  Attorney Sam Obscherning appeared by video for Daquan Tyanthony Blue.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court with 21CM3371 which has been adjourned. Court orders case to follow.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Daquan Tyanthony Blue appeared by video.  Attorney Sam Obscherning appeared by video for Daquan Tyanthony Blue.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Daquan T Blue in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held. Defense counsel was recently appointed on defendant's new case and requests additional status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Daquan Tyanthony Blue in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Daquan Tyanthony Blue in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daquan Tyanthony Blue appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
